HubSpot Devs - I have uploaded a CSV file for bulk redirects and I get a import successful message, however the redirects are not updating from the original which I have selected in the upload process, is there an issue with the overwrite feature of bulk redirects. I am using absolute URLs and using the example CSV file format provided in the KB article
Hi, I need help to get all informations about contact, deal, searching for a custom propriety, for exemplo:
```Can I get this contat and bussiness informations by this id in Api?```
but the response is;
I want more information

To get the details, you need to add the required properties in the properties array param in the API request. HS API provides limited details by default.

You can change which properties are returned in the response by using the `properties` array in the request body (array-like shown in attached image)
I think i got you, but for exemplo i search for a properties in (GET/<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/deals>) and i find thi field:
I try to use this body:
but i don't see the proprierty "deal owner" in the response.

So turns out, that it had to do with choosing the “ignore protocol”, since the original redirect created  had that selected, it created the https version because that was what it was in the CSV, but when I chose that option, it actually created a new redirect for non-https, so basically it was never updating the original https one. I had to re-import the CSV with all set to FALSE for `ignore protocol` and make sure all urls were indeed https, pretty confused why it made non-https versions of the URLs when I was listed as https in the CSV
However, now none of my redirects are working at all, so go figure, even though I see them in the system as accurate URLs
Once the urls are in it can take a bit for them to kick in. You will likely also need to flush your dns cache in order to see the redirects which can be a bit finicky.

Can you please confirm if the `deal owner` is not empty in HubSpot for that particular deal? HubSpot API doesn't provide properties (that has empty or null value in HS) in the API response, even if it mentions the property in the API request.

Hi everyone! Not sure exactly where to put this, but we hit a bit of a wall with HubSpot support and I'm hoping maybe someone else here has run into this issue and can speak to it. I'm trying to get set up with the HubSpot calendar integration on landing pages, but what we're running up against is that our emails use a hybrid exchange environment as we're not fully on Office 365 (in the process of moving over, but it is taking some time). This is causing some issues. The actual email we're trying to connect to a calendar is an office 365 account, but because it's a hybrid environment we're continuing to run into errors. Has anyone run into this issue before? Trying to gauge if this is workable or if we need to find an alternate calendar solution until we're fully migrated to Office 365.
Hi <@U026DBFPCUU>, what differences are you seeing?

<@U01PJMZ5KPH> Yes, i am using this POST /deals/v1/deal/, but how i will pass line item data in associations object?
what should way to pass line item data in associations object?

Please can you share share a example of json object

You need to create a Line Item first in HS with another API. Once it is created, you can utilize the relevant Line Item ID in the associate Object to associate the details.

Or, you can utilize the Sync Message API as well: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/ecommerce/v2/send-sync-messages>.
